headline: Pennsylvania GOP Senate Race Might Be Headed for Recount
author: John McCormick
sentences:
His supporters tend to be anti-incumbent, which isnt going to help the state house and senate candidates in close races in November.?
Mr. Becker added: Theres still a lot of potential for this to be a wasted opportunity for Pennsylvania Republicans in what could be a very good year for Republicans nationally.?
Pennsylvania is one of about a half-dozen states nationally that analysts say are most likely to determine party control of the Senate.

The outcome of Pennsylvanias intensely fought Republican U.S. Senate primary remained uncertain as election officials continued to count mail ballots early Wednesday, the day after primaries in five states showed there are limits to Donald Trumps grip on GOP voters.

With 95% of the expected vote tabulated, the Associated Press had yet to call the contest, as celebrity surgeon Mehmet Oz and former hedge-fund executive David McCormick were separated by a razor-thin margin that could potentially send the race to a recount.

The former college football player and one-time suburban mayor beat Rep. Conor Lamb, a more button-down candidate and former federal prosecutor who until recently was viewed as a sort of model candidate for Democrats trying to win in competitive areas.

His candidate, Rep. Ted Budd, won the GOPs U.S. Senate nomination, while Rep. Madison Cawthorn, the youngest member of Congress and someone dogged by a series of indiscretions and blunders, lost his primary to state Sen. Chuck Edwards.

Trumps endorsements continue to be very hit or miss,? said GOP consultant Alex Conant, who led communications for Sen. Marco Rubios 2016 presidential campaign and served as a spokesman in the second Bush White House.

Jamie McLeod-Skinner, a small-business owner and an emergency-response coordinator who ran to his political left, had drawn support from voters who saw Mr. Schrader as not doing enough to support Mr. Bidens agenda.

He cant transfer his political capital to others.?
Democrats face considerable headwinds in this years midterm elections because of high inflation and sagging approval ratings for Mr. Biden, among other factors.

Mr. Budd will face Democrat Cheri Beasley, a former chief justice of the North Carolina Supreme Court, who if elected would be the third Black woman senator in history and the first one from North Carolina.

Party activists were closely watching the results of the primaries in Oregon, including one testing President Bidens endorsement of Rep. Kurt Schrader, who was trailing against a challenger from the left.
Democrats and some Republicans believe that could be the case for Doug Mastriano, a strong supporter of the former presidents false allegations of widespread fraud in the 2020 presidential election.
Mr. Trump endorsed Mr. Mastriano three days before the primary even as some Pennsylvania Republicans questioned whether the state senator would be a strong general-election candidate.
Both parties, as they compete for a seat now held by retiring Republican Sen. Pat Toomey, are expected to court white, working-class voters who have increasingly favored Republicans.
His candidacy is still going to be a big issue in the fall because he does no favors to any Republican candidates down-ballot,? said Jeff Becker, a GOP strategist in Pennsylvania.
Mr. Fetterman easily won the Democratic contest the same day he had a pacemaker implanted, after being knocked off the campaign trail by a stroke four days before the primary.
Pennsylvania requires a recount in statewide races if the margin between the top two candidates is within 0.5 percentage points, a process that could take several days.
The race has national implications for the 2024 presidential election because Pennsylvanias governor appoints the secretary of state, who oversees the states elections.
Democrats across the multiple primaries backed several progressive or unconventional candidates like Mr. Fetterman, who often campaigned in shorts and hoodies.
In Oregon, Mr. Schrader, a member of the centrist group known as Blue Dog Democrats, was trailing in his primary ahead of his attempt to seek an eighth term.
Since the state doesnt allow officials to process mail ballots for tabulation ahead of Election Day, Pennsylvania is slower than some others to count votes.
The Republican nominee will enter the general election having been subject to significantly more negative television advertising than Mr. Fetterman.
Mr. Oz, Mr. McCormick and their allies spent almost $57 millionmuch of it negative in tonethrough the primary, data from ad-tracker AdImpact shows.
Army Reserve veteran and commentator Kathy Barnette, who had surged late in the contest, was in third place and too far behind to be a contender.
Analysts predict that the contest will be competitive but give Mr. Budd an edge in the November to replace retiring Republican Sen. Richard Burr.
Mr. Trump had endorsed Mr. Oz, so his standing as a party kingmaker will either be enhanced or diminished based on the Pennsylvania outcome.
They are hoping Republicans will nominate candidates closely aligned with Mr. Trump who might struggle to win swing voters in November.
Unofficial results showed Mr. McCormick leading in votes cast by mail counted so far, while Mr. Oz was ahead in the Election Day vote.
A ballot-printing issue in a key county there delayed counting and could result in the outcome of the race not being known for days.
Mr. Mastriano appeared at Mr. Trumps Washington rally on Jan. 6, 2021, but says he didnt take part in the violence at the Capitol.
Mr. Fetterman, who has worked hard to try to win back some of those voters, is rooted in the partys progressive wing.
Mr. Lamb said Tuesday that he would support Mr. Fetterman because our entire democracy is on the line? in November.
He emerged from a crowded GOP primary for governor in Pennsylvania and will face Democratic nominee Josh Shapiro.
All three of the top primary finishers portrayed themselves as strong supporters of the former president.
The day of balloting showed Mr. Trumps influence on GOP voters remains significant, but not absolute.
North Carolina delivered a split verdict on his highest-profile endorsements in the state.
Both had sought Mr. Trumps backing during visits to his Mar-a-Lago club in Florida.
